trans-unit.source: This example assumes that you have lightweight code you can run in the background to enhance your app while the device is plugged in.
trans-unit.target: This example assumes that you have lightweight code you can run in the background to enhance your app while the device is plugged in.

trans-unit.source: This topic focuses on the [**MaintenanceTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700517) class, which is similar to [**SystemTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224839).
trans-unit.target: This topic focuses on the [**MaintenanceTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700517) class, which is similar to [**SystemTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224839).

trans-unit.source: More information on writing a background task class is available in [Create and register a background task](create-and-register-a-background-task.md).
trans-unit.target: More information on writing a background task class is available in [Create and register a background task](create-and-register-a-background-task.md).

trans-unit.source: The second parameter, *OneShot*, specifies whether the maintenance task will run once or continue to run periodically.
trans-unit.target: The second parameter, *OneShot*, specifies whether the maintenance task will run once or continue to run periodically.

trans-unit.source: If *OneShot* is set to true, the first parameter (*FreshnessTime*) specifies the number of minutes to wait before scheduling the background task.
trans-unit.target: If *OneShot* is set to true, the first parameter (*FreshnessTime*) specifies the number of minutes to wait before scheduling the background task.

trans-unit.source: If *OneShot* is set to false, *FreshnessTime* specifies the frequency by which the background task will run.
trans-unit.target: If *OneShot* is set to false, *FreshnessTime* specifies the frequency by which the background task will run.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If *FreshnessTime* is set to less than 15 minutes, an exception is thrown when attempting to register the background task.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If *FreshnessTime* is set to less than 15 minutes, an exception is thrown when attempting to register the background task.

trans-unit.source: **Note** For all device families except desktop, if the device becomes low on memory, background tasks may be terminated.
trans-unit.target: **Note** For all device families except desktop, if the device becomes low on memory, background tasks may be terminated.

trans-unit.source: If an out of memory exception is not surfaced, or the app does not handle it, then the background task will be terminated without warning and without raising the OnCanceled event.
trans-unit.target: If an out of memory exception is not surfaced, or the app does not handle it, then the background task will be terminated without warning and without raising the OnCanceled event.

trans-unit.source: This helps to ensure the user experience of the app in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: This helps to ensure the user experience of the app in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: Your background task should be designed to handle this scenario.
trans-unit.target: Your background task should be designed to handle this scenario.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Universal Windows apps must call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) before registering any of the background trigger types.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Universal Windows apps must call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) before registering any of the background trigger types.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call [**RemoveAccess**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700471) and then call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) when your app launches after being updated.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call [**RemoveAccess**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700471) and then call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) when your app launches after being updated.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Guidelines for background tasks](guidelines-for-background-tasks.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Guidelines for background tasks](guidelines-for-background-tasks.md).

trans-unit.source: **Note** Background task registration parameters are validated at the time of registration.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Background task registration parameters are validated at the time of registration.

trans-unit.source: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.
trans-unit.target: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your app gracefully handles scenarios where background task registration fails - if instead your app depends on having a valid registration object after attempting to register a task, it may crash.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your app gracefully handles scenarios where background task registration fails - if instead your app depends on having a valid registration object after attempting to register a task, it may crash.
